pageContext.claim: “What I'm saying is that it's [$400 million in debt] a tiny percentage of my net worth....I am extremely under levered....When you look at that, the amount of money, $400 million is a peanut. It's extremely under leveraged and it's leveraged with normal banks, not a big deal.”
pageContext.analysis: We have no way to evaluate these statements because Trump has not released his tax returns. But given his track record of mendacity, if he says that he is "under leveraged," then he is probably over leveraged. When he was in business, in 1990 Trump called himself the king of cash just before he had to file for bankruptcy protection because of crushing debts.
